description: Related to miration. Ultimately from Latin mīror (“marvel at”).

verbs.description: mirate (third-person singular simple present mirates, present participle mirating, simple past and past participle mirated)

entries.meaning: (Southern US, Midland US, uncommon) To marvel at. [since the late 1800s]
examples: With Bud in her arms and Babe at her heels, she rushed from one part of the  court to another, laughing boisterously at Paulo's monkey pranks, and "mirating" over Francesca's tawdry finery.
